data.title: Vegetarians Love the Best Darn Salad in Town for the Price
data.text: Yes, Il Vicino is a pizzeria of the first order. But having given up eating wheat, I no longer indulge. However, I never feel deprived. This place has enormous, luscious salads with many options of greens, three kinds of tomatoes, raw or sautéed onions and garlic, cheese toppings, meat toppings and velvety dressings I have on the side. Choose your protein. Don't forget to drizzle a little of the house-made spicy olive oil too. It's got a lovely, subtle heat I adore.  They are happy to customize in every way. There are also gorgeous pasta dishes and desserts here. The service is usually great. The locals eat here regularly you know it's great.

data.title: Good Lunch!
data.text: While on our way to the Balloon Fiesta we stopped in to Il Vicino for lunch and were very pleased. Service was stellar, even as a QSR spot and the pizza was tasty and ready in a flash. All members of my party enjoyed their salads, sandwiches and pizza and the place was spotless - even the bathroom. Keep up the good work!

data.title: Good pizza, good beer, good wine
data.text: Visited the Nob Hill location while on a recent trip to Albuquerque. Food and service were very good. The servers work as a team to provide for customers. Many times this arrangement is rather slip shod, but not here. Everything was delivered hot or cold as the cvase may be. The pizza was fired in the wood oven and was delicious.There are many menu variations to tempt your taste buds.

data.title: Best Pizza Ever!
data.text: We were visiting Albuquerque for the first time and stumbled across this amazing pizza place.  Great drinks, great salads, awesome wood-fired pizza.  We were blown away!

data.title: PIZZA
data.text: A very good break from normal pizza. Fresh and excellent cheeses to pick from and eccellent service.

data.title: Tasty and quick
data.text: We visited at 9:30 on a Tuesday evening. It was our first visit to the Il Vicino restaurant group. You order at the door then your meal is brought to you. The house salad with added goat cheese was perfectly dressed and perfect for splitting. The infused olive oil at each table is tasty and definitely spicy. We split the basic calzone sans roasted red pepper. It was perfect. The red sauce has a nice mild fennel undertone that was well-suited to the cheesy interior.

data.title: Bready pizza
data.text: The pizza bases were much more 'bready' than as a European I am used to. The toppings were adequate. The staff was friendly and service reasonably quick. A plus is that prices are extremely reasonable.

data.title: Excellent Food!
data.text: This is a small Italian restaurant on a popular strip.  You order  and pay when you walk in. The waiter then brings your drinks and delivers your food when it is ready. While that may sound like  cafeteria style, it actually works quite well. I ordered the Margherita Pizza for $7.50. At that price I thought it was a personal size. It was not! It was a very nice size and I took half of it home. I also had the Caesar Salad which was very fresh and delicious. All the people I was with ordered some kind of salad and everyone agreed that the freshness made all the difference. Those who ordered sandwiches were also very pleased with the taste and size of the meal. I can truly find nothing negative to say. It was a memorable meal with friends and family!

data.title: Overall good pizza
data.text: Positive thing: they have a brick oven. Crust was cooked the correct amount of time but I personally didn't like the taste of it. Same for the mozzarella...a better mozzarella would have changed completely my opinion. Overall pizza was good but there's area for improvement. Nice that they have spicy/hot oil on each table. Place was nice and relaxed.

data.title: Great Pizza and Beer
data.text: A varied variety of pizza, beer and other dishes. Why would anyone go to fast food pizza joint when you have this place instead! Best pizza in Albuquerque. Personal size pizzas, salad and a beer for a reasonable price. The service is attentive to your needs and friendly. I'll be back!

data.title: Okay for Lacto Vegetarian
data.text:
Like many places in Nob Hill there is some effort to provide a degree of vegetarian fare though finding vegan requires some work on the part of the patron. This establishment has been around a while in Nob Hill and has undergone at least one renovation over the years.

It has also been uneven in the quality of the food and at times I would NOT rank it the highest in regard to pizza, that honor remains with Amore.

If not pizza than the lacto choice for me is the LASAGNA GIARDINIERE. When heated properly, this is a piece from a larger precooked tray that is refrigerated, its pretty good and tasty. A pleasant blend with the addition of pesto on top and fresh ground Parmesan cheese grated for you by the wait person.

I had dinner with three friends on this occasion and we always come away with a couple of gripes that persist even though we know we are not the only ones with the same thoughts.

Because everything is somewhat prepped and in a fixed state it is difficult to have an alteration of an item. Example the CALZONE VEGETARIANO which is made with goat cheese. A number of occasions I have had to pass on this selection because they could not or would not substitute mozzarella for the goat cheese. One time I was told they don't have mozzarella ... what are you kidding? I personally dislike goat cheese for a number of reasons. Others in my dining group have had similar problems with other selections.

Its a nice touch to have bread, which is pretty good, with olive oil. The only problem the oil oil is not plain. The only choice is a "spiced" oil that is rather hot. The portion of bread that is provided is "skimpy" at best. At a minimum it would be nice to have enough to sop up the sauce remainders or dressing remainders if you have a side salad.

Salad is somewhat limited as a vegetarian choice, at times it seems impossible to get an order of something other than the house salad without meat or fish, or dressing without anchovies. (The original Caesar Cardini  Salad dressing was made without anchovies ... ask me how I know.)

The soup selection remains a vegetarian mystery. I have yet to get a consist answer about the contents, so I opt out.

All and all it is a reasonable choice for a mixed group of food ethics, not perfect though.

The place can be noisy and crowed at times. They have a selection of their own brewery beer which is competent as well as a varying selection of wine.

data.title: Pizza almost to die for!
data.text: Go there for lunch sometimes and for dinner as well.  They have excellent salads and a whole array of other Italian type cuisine.  The Salsiccia  pizza is quite good as is their Pepperoni.  If you like crafted beer with your pizza, this is definitely the place for you.

data.title: Fantastic Pizza!  So NOT Pizza Hut!!
data.text: First time visit for us.  You walk in and are asked to place order before seating yourself.  Menus are at the door if you need a minute to decide.  Just a few feet away is someone who was eager to take our order and accommodate our requests.  We ordered, paid and took our order stem with number and seats.  Within a relatively short period of time, our order was promptly delivered with fresh parm.  Pizza was original, amazing, hot and timely.  We were served with pleasantry throughout our meal and this has been one of the rarest of occasions when we were never left waiting for drinks or anything for that matter.  Our table was cleared immediately which is super rare.  It's nice to have a conversation without looking at dirty dishes in front of you.  Clean, the oven was a joy to see and we had a very nice time and super nice meal!  Thank you!

data.title: Grab a pizza with wine!
data.text:
Location: Not from NM a friend took us here right when I flew in! Street parking!

Customer Service: It was pretty late at night not too many people but we were seated right away and the food came out quick!

Decor: Reminds me a lot of a little hipster joint, or a restaurant I would have went to when I was in Portland! Totally not a bad thing of course, it just has that chill vibe!

Presentation of Food: Pizza!!!

How did the food taste?: AMAZING, after a long flight from the bay area this hit the spot! The pizza was great and I wish they had this spot back here in the bay. I am sure they would get good business. It's a gourmet pizza, but not too fancy. Grab a glass of wine with the pizza and all is good!

Overall Experience: Good!

Would I Come Back?: Yes, yes, and yes!

data.title: A Bit Tight Space but Well Laid Out - Great Food
data.text:
The place is a bit tight. But as you walk in, you smell the great aroma of fresh food and pizza baking. 

Well, yeah, pizza (and salad) were ordered. Wine is available as well. 

Overall, the food is great. You are just here for lunch and leave. It is too noisy for business lunch conversation.

data.title: Good value
data.text: Way beyond the chain stores although they have several around the country.  Nice and quite and good fresh selections.

data.title: Always a great eating experience
data.text: For my family, our favorite location is the one on the West side at Corrales. For those who do not know, you will see a huge menu right when entering, and then you proceed to the register to order. After you order and pay they will give you a number so your server can find you at whatever table you choose, either inside or in the nice cozy patio outside. You are not required to pay the tip then, unless you want to. My absolute favorite pizza is the Testarossa, you cannot go wrong with its Greek flavors. The waiters have always been excellent at this location and if you bring kids they will give them a piece of raw pizza dough for them to play and entertain themselves. Pizzas do not take to  long to be ready. One more thing, the pizzas are personal size, you may share one with someone but will be left hungry if you have a good appetite, the kids' pizzas are generously portioned. Try the house salad with fresh parmesan and spicy oil, it is goooooooooood!!!

data.title: Busy, but great paninis!
data.text: We stopped to eat here right before the holidays while doing some shopping. The pizza at Il Vicino is always good, but we both opted for paninis. They were excellent, and the portions are generous. The service was good and quick as well.

data.title: Not everybody knows about your concept
data.text:
We got there and nobody was at the gate, so we saw a girls and asked for a table. She gave us a table and after 10min, we asked for menus, a server told us that we had to order before sitting. 
The front desk guy  were very rude blaming us for not reading the signs... they wanted us to pay for the food and include an 18% tip... we said we would be glad to leave a tip afterwards, as the initial service was not the best...
We finally eat, pizzas were very good and our server made a huge effort to give us great service.
we did leave a tip :), so make sure you order first!

data.title: Best pizza in Albuquerque
data.text: Seriously. The best pizza in the city and I consider myself a pizza connoisseur. Wood oven pizzas. I love the #9 with goat cheese, mushrooms and sausage. Lots of good choices.  Have beer they brew at off sight facility.
